title: Coin flipping example
text: Load coin model example data available within treepplr. data example sequence coin flip results. treeppl can read data JSON format, ’s example data format.
code: model <- tp_model("coin") data <- tp_data("coin") str(data) #> List of 1 #>  $ coinflips: logi [1:20] FALSE TRUE TRUE TRUE FALSE TRUE ...

title: Coin flipping example
text: Now can compile run TreePPL program. function tp_treeppl() many optional arguments change inference method used. , use default settings inference methods, run 100 sweeps 100 particles within sweep.
code: output_list <- tp_treeppl(model = model, data = data, samples = 100, n_runs = 100)

title: Coin flipping example
text: Just compare different MCMC runs/chains test convergence, SMC tun several sweeps compare normalizing constants test converged posterior distribution. criterion convergence variance normalizing constants across sweeps lower 1.
code: tp_smc_convergence(output_list) #> [1] 0.01126985  output <-  tp_parse(output_list) %>%    dplyr::mutate(total_lweight = log_weight + norm_const) %>%    dplyr::mutate(norm_weight = exp(total_lweight - max(.$total_lweight)))  ggplot2::ggplot(output, ggplot2::aes(samples, weight = norm_weight)) +   ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(density)),                  col = "white", fill = "lightblue", binwidth=0.01) +   ggplot2::geom_density() +   ggplot2::theme_bw()

title: Constant rate birth (CRB) model
text: use example (random) tree comes package.  need convert tree TreePPL readable format read CRB model.
code: tree <- ape::read.tree(system.file(   "extdata/crb_tree_15_tips.tre", package = "treepplr")) ape::plot.phylo(tree, cex = 0.5) axisPhylo() data <- tp_phylo_to_tpjson(tree, age="tip-to-root") model <- tp_model(system.file("extdata/crb.tppl", package = "treepplr"))

title: Constant rate birth (CRB) model
text: Compile run TreePPL program standard inference settings.

title: Constant rate birth (CRB) model
text: TreePPL outputs log weight sample, first need get normalized weights can plot posterior distribution produced.
code: # turn list into a data frame where each row represents one sample  # and calculate normalized weights from log weights and normalizing constants. output <-  tp_parse(output_list) %>%    dplyr::mutate(total_lweight = log_weight + norm_const) %>%    dplyr::mutate(norm_weight = exp(total_lweight - max(.$total_lweight)))  ggplot2::ggplot(output, ggplot2::aes(samples, weight = norm_weight)) +   ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(density)),                  col = "white", fill = "lightblue", binwidth=0.04) +   ggplot2::geom_density() +   ggplot2::theme_bw()

title: Host repertoire model example
text: Load 3-state host repertoire model example data available within treepplr.

title: Tree inference
text: Load tree inference model example data available within treepplr. data example toy dataset …
code: model <- tp_model("tree_inference") data <- tp_data("tree_inference") str(data) #> List of 1 #>  $ data: int [1:4, 1:15] 1 1 0 0 1 1 0 0 0 0 ...

title: Tree inference
text: Now can compile run TreePPL program. function tp_treeppl() many optional arguments change inference method used. , use result list sweeps, one containing 3 elements: sampled parameter values weights (log scale) 5 particles sweep, normalizing constant whole sweep.
code: output_list <- tp_treeppl(model = model, data = data, method = "smc-apf",                            samples = 1000, subsample = 5, resample = "manual",                            n_runs = 10) str(output_list,max.level = 2) #> List of 10 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.1 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.3 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.4 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.3 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.5 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.4 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.4 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.4 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.5 #>  $ :List of 3 #>   ..$ samples  :List of 10 #>   ..$ weights  :List of 10 #>   ..$ normConst: num -79.4

title: Tree inference
text: example check different runs converged posterior, checking variance normalizing constant among runs. different ways summarize posterior distribution trees. examples, calculate MAP (Maximum Posteriori) tree. finding single tree topology highest posterior probability, using ape::consensus compute average branch lengths sampled trees MAP topology.
code: tp_smc_convergence(output_list) #> [1] 0.01258822 out_trees <- tp_json_to_phylo(output_list)  map_tree <- tp_map_tree(out_trees) #> [1] "MAP Topology found" #> [1] "Posterior Probability: 0.8164" #> [1] "Based on the topology of 83 samples out of 100" plot(map_tree) axisPhylo()

title: R Interface to TreePPL
text: treepplr R Interface TreePPL, probabilistic programming language phylogenetics. treepplr converts data format readable TreePPL, reads TreePPL output, connects downstream analyses model-specific packages, evolnets package host repertoire evolution model. See package’s documentation .

title: R Interface to TreePPL

text: function checks input tp_go().

title: Check input for inference with TreePPL — tp_check_input
Check input for inference with TreePPL — tp_check_input
text: model TreePPL model (S3) data list item name accordingly data structure model.

title: Check input for inference with TreePPL — tp_check_input
Compile for tp_run() — tp_compile
text: tp_compile compile TreePPL model use tp_run.

title: Compile for tp_run() — tp_compile
code: tp_compile(   model_file_name = "tmp_model_file",   samples = 1000,   seed = NULL,   method = "smc-bpf",   align = FALSE,   cps = "none",   delay = NULL,   kernel = NULL,   mcmc_lw_gprob = NULL,   pmcmc_particles = NULL,   prune = FALSE,   subsample = NULL,   resample = NULL )

title: Compile for tp_run() — tp_compile
text: model_file_name character vector giving model name. samples base::integer giving number samples (mcmc) particules (smc). seed base::numeric use random seed. method character vector giving inference method name. align base::logical tell need align model. cps character vector giving configuration CPS transformation. delay character vector giving configuration delayed sampling. kernel base::numeric value giving driftScale driftKernel MCMC. mcmc_lw_gprob base::numeric probability performing global MCMC step. pmcmc_particles base::integer number particles smc proposal computation prune base::logical tell model try pruned. subsample base::integer number draw subsample posterior distribution. resample character vector giving selected resample placement method.

title: Compile for tp_run() — tp_compile
text: R's base::tempdir() whreŕe compile file stored.

title: Compile for tp_run() — tp_compile
text: model_file_name : character vector giving tp_treeppl model name.  Use tp_stored_data name already write model tp_treeppl. seed : random seed use. Using 'NULL' initialized randomly. method : Inference method used. selected inference method. supported methods : -lw, smc-bpf, smc-apf, mcmc-lightweight, mcmc-trace, mcmc-naive, pmcmc-pimh. following options highly dependable method used. Check [implemented yet] information. align : Whether align model certain inference algorithms. cps : Configuration CPS transformation (applicable certain inference algorithms). supported options : none, partial, full. delay : model transformed efficient representation possible. supported options : static dynamic. Use 'NULL' ignore. kernel : value driftScale driftKernel MCMC. Use 'NULL' ignore. Use conjuction method mcmc-lightweight". Use 'NULL' ignore mcmc_lw_gprob : probability performing global MH step (non-global means modify single sample previous trace). Use conjuction method mcmc-lightweight". Use 'NULL' ignore pmcmc_particles : number particles smc proposal computation. option used one following methods used: pmcmc-*. Use 'NULL' ignore prune : model pruned possible. subsample : number draw subsample posterior distribution. Use conjuction method smc-apf smc-bpf. Use 'NULL' ignore. resample: selected resample placement method, inference algorithms applicable. supported methods : likelihood (resample immediately likelihood updates), align (resample aligned likelihood updates, forces –align), manual (sample manually defined resampling locations). Use 'NULL' ignore.

Convert phylo obj to TreePPL tree — tp_phylo_to_tpjson
text: phylo_tree object class ape::phylo. age string determines way age nodes calculated (default "branch-length"). "branch-length" : Root's age = NA, branch-length parent branch "root--tip" : Root's age = 0.0, cumulative branch-length root "tip--root" : Leaf's age = 0.0, cumulative branch-length leaf

what: Compile and run a TreePPL program — tp_treeppl
title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — tp_treeppl
text: tp_treeppl execute TreePPL return TreePPL output (string JSON format).

title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — tp_treeppl
code: tp_treeppl(   model = NULL,   model_file_name = "tmp_model_file",   data = NULL,   data_file_name = "tmp_data_file",   compile_model = TRUE,   samples = 1000,   seed = NULL,   n_runs = 1,   method = "smc-bpf",   align = FALSE,   cps = "none",   delay = NULL,   kernel = NULL,   mcmc_lw_gprob = NULL,   pmcmc_particles = NULL,   prune = FALSE,   subsample = NULL,   resample = NULL )

title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — tp_treeppl
text: model TreePPL model (S3). model_file_name character vector giving model name. data phyjson object (S3). data_file_name character vector giving data name. compile_model base::logical tell model need compile samples base::integer giving number samples (mcmc) particules (smc). seed base::numeric use random seed. n_runs base::integer giving number run (mcmc)/sweap (smc). method character vector giving inference method name. align base::logical tell need align model. cps character vector giving configuration CPS transformation. delay character vector giving configuration delayed sampling. kernel base::numeric value giving driftScale driftKernel MCMC. mcmc_lw_gprob base::numeric probability performing global MCMC step. pmcmc_particles base::integer number particles smc proposal computation prune base::logical tell model try pruned. subsample base::integer number draw subsample posterior distribution. resample character vector giving selected resample placement method

title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — tp_treeppl
text: list TreePPL output parsed JSON format.

title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — tp_treeppl
text: function takes TreePPL object (S3) phyjson object (S3), compile TreePPL model, run data returning TreePPL output. TreePPL need install computer PATH set R/RSTUDIO (see install manual). executable output files written R's base::tempdir(). model : TreePPL model (S3), see tp_model details. Use 'NULL' previously provide model. Check already provide model tp_stored_model. model_file_name : character vector giving tp_treeppl model name.  Use tp_stored_data name already write model tp_treeppl. data : list, see tp_check_input() details. Use 'NULL' previously provide data. Check already provide data tp_stored_data. data_file_name : character vector giving tp_treeppl data name. Use tp_stored_data name already write data tp_treeppl. compile_model : base::logical telling model need compiled. Can use avoid compile model R's base::tempdir() already compile model previous call tp_treeppl. Check already compile model tp_stored_compiled. samples : number samples (mcmc) / particules (smc) inference. seed : random seed use. Using 'NULL' initialized randomly. n_runs : number run (mcmc) / sweap (smc) used inference. method : Inference method used. selected inference method. supported methods : -lw, smc-bpf, smc-apf, mcmc-lightweight, mcmc-trace, mcmc-naive, pmcmc-pimh. following options highly dependable method used. Check [implemented yet] information. align : Whether align model certain inference algorithms. cps : Configuration CPS transformation (applicable certain inference algorithms). supported options : none, partial, full. delay : model transformed efficient representation possible. supported options : static dynamic. Use 'NULL' ignore. kernel : value driftScale driftKernel MCMC. Use 'NULL' ignore. Use conjuction method mcmc-lightweight". Use 'NULL' ignore mcmc_lw_gprob : probability performing global MH step (non-global means modify single sample previous trace). Use conjuction method mcmc-lightweight". Use 'NULL' ignore pmcmc_particles : number particles smc proposal computation. option used one following methods used: pmcmc-*. Use 'NULL' ignore prune : model pruned possible. subsample : number draw subsample posterior distribution. Use conjuction method smc-apf smc-bpf. Use 'NULL' ignore. resample: selected resample placement method, inference algorithms applicable. supported methods : likelihood (resample immediately likelihood updates), align (resample aligned likelihood updates, forces –align), manual (sample manually defined resampling locations). Use 'NULL' ignore.

text: model TreePPL model (S3). model_file_name character vector giving model name. data phyjson object (S3). data_file_name character vector giving data name.

title: Prepare input for tp_compile() — tp_write
text: function takes TreePPL object (S3) phyjson object (S3) write base::tempdir(). model : TreePPL model (S3), see tp_model details. Use 'NULL' previously provide model. Check already provide model tp_stored_model. model_file_name : character vector giving tp_treeppl model name.  Use tp_stored_data name already write model tp_write. data : list, see tp_check_input() details. Use 'NULL' previously provide data. Check already provide data tp_stored_data. data_file_name : character vector giving tp_treeppl data name. Use tp_stored_data name already write data tp_write.

Calculate age in a tppl_tree — tree_age_cumul
text: tree tppl_tree create tp_phylo_to_tppl_tree. root_index index root tppl_tree. age string determine way age node calculated (default "branch-length"). "root--tip" : Root's age = 0.0, cumulative branch-length root "tip--root" : Leaf's age = 0.0, cumulative branch-length leaf
